thread.title: NFF Boss Amaju Pinnick charges Super eagles to beat Cameroon in friendly game
thread.title_full: NFF Boss Amaju Pinnick charges Super eagles to beat Cameroon in friendly game

title: NFF Boss Amaju Pinnick charges Super eagles to beat Cameroon in friendly game
text:
15:55 CET NFF Boss Amaju Pinnick charges Super eagles to beat Cameroon in friendly game - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
NFF President Amaju Pinnick has challenged the Super Eagles to approach their international friendly against Cameroon on Sunday with gusto and attain victory in order to make Nigerians forget Thursday's defeat by the Democratic Republic of Congo. 
First half goals by Dieumerci Mbokani and Jordan Nkololo gave the Leopards a 2-0 win over the Super Eagles in Vise, Belgium on Thursday. Pinnick, who watched the game in company with NFF Vice Presidents Seyi Akinwunmi and Shehu Dikko, told the players in the dressing room after the match to forget whatever issues had arisen in the camp over the past few days and attack the Indomitable Lions with passion. 
For more Ghana football news visit www.ghanasoccernet.com Sports News Follow Us Better a dream born at the mountain top than a vision received in a valley deep By: Adjei Agyei-Baah
